column4: hi guys, how do I set up ssh equivalent logins for all my machines? I need to login as admin to quite a few machines, and would prefer not to type that many ssh passwords
you can use ssh with keys, so you only need to type the passphrase for the key
would I have to type the passphrase every time?
you can also set no passphrase, though I do not recommend it if you can avoid it. Or use caching.
it'll be only from one workstation, which is in an access-controlled area. I think it'll be safe with no passphrase
How many machines you are dealing with?
a lab, it's about 80 all told
access controlled physically or networkwise? You'd want both.
Well, you are the admin there, I assume, so both the decision and the responsibility on it is yours. :)
yes Lynoure, thanks... just needed a bit of advice as a kickstart to a monday morning
actually Lynoure, i think that I'm going to go with shosts-based authentication ...
thanks for the help Lynoure, it pointed me in the right direction
